position.marginalia_text: Articuli continua agitatione exercendi: sensusq[ue] similiter. Eudoxi medici perpetua admonitio.

marginalia.translation: The joints must be exercised with continuous movement: and the senses likewise. The continual reminder of Eudoxus' doctor.
The continual movement of joints and senses.

position.marginalia_text: Singularis exercendi aphorismus: apud Laertiu[m], in vita Eudoxi.

marginalia.translation: The singular aphorism of exercising, according to Laertius in his life of Eudoxus.
The actualization of Eudromus before all things.

position.marginalia_text: Animus est omnia. Mens super omnia.

marginalia.translation: The rational soul is all things. The mind is above all things.
All things are nothing, unless the soul is animated.

position.marginalia_text: Omnis cura, hodierna: hesterna, nimis sera: crastina, nimis cita. Sufficit cuiq[ue] diei sua cura.

marginalia.translation: Take care with everything daily; yesterday is too late, tomorrow, rouse yourself excessively. Each day's own attention is sufficient for anyone.

position.marginalia_text: Axiophili expeditum viaticu[m]. Seria vis hodierna: industria crastina sera. Viua, potensq[ue] animi possessio, copia vita[e]. diuinum Arcanum. Solum vita[e] ephodion, Viuus, potensq[ue] animus.

marginalia.translation: The ready viaticum of Axiophilus. Serious power is daily, tomorrow's industry is too slow. A lively and firm possession of the mind is an abundance of life. A divine secret. The sole ephodion of life is a lively and firm mind.

position.marginalia_text: Apostoli, nihil habentes viatici, nullo carebant viatico.

marginalia.translation: The Apostles, having no viaticum, lacked no viaticum.
